body_html: @tomjaguarpw, the actual option name is tensorflow_BUILD_SHARED_LIB, not BUILD_SHARED_LIB. If you use that, cmake generates a project tensorflow.vcxproj (not tensorflow.sln!) which you can use to build the DLL.
body_text: @tomjaguarpw, the actual option name is tensorflow_BUILD_SHARED_LIB, not BUILD_SHARED_LIB. If you use that, cmake generates a project tensorflow.vcxproj (not tensorflow.sln!) which you can use to build the DLL.
body: @tomjaguarpw, the actual option name is tensorflow_BUILD_SHARED_LIB, not BUILD_SHARED_LIB. If you use that, cmake generates a project tensorflow.vcxproj (not tensorflow.sln!) which you can use to build the DLL.
